website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty rust protection that was designed for Boeing to protect airplanes from rust.
pros: Protects metal from rust for months
Helps loosen metal pieces that are already rusted
cons: Wax can dry in the can and make it hard to spray

customer_reviews.title: Bad Cans, good stuff ..  UPDATED -  PROBLEM RESOLVED
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great product and love the way it works, BUT each of the last two cans I have purchased have stopped spraying very soon after initial use. Too much money for a can of spray that lasts for less than 10% of the contents. Guess I need to find an alternative. Contacted the Company that makes Boeshield. They were excellent to deal with. THEY SUGGESTED I SOAK THE CANS IN HOT WATER FOR AN HOUR THEN TRY. WORKED PERFECT. NO MORE ISSUES. The company replaced the original products. Excellent company and excellent product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: fyrmrshl

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST OF THE BEST Lubricant and metal protector !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best lubricant and metal protector on the market.... This stuff does an excellent job in lubricating bike chains.... Just remember to apply the lubricant after riding.... By applying this lubricant after the ride including using a rag to wipe off the excess, the T-9 both cleans the chain and the nset ups over 3 hours as a waxy film.... Your chain attracts far less dirt with this lube.... I have used this T9 for over 10 years and have never found anything close to it on the market.... I also use this on my cars, trailers, lawnmowers etc... Anywhere that I want to either lubricate or protect metal from rusting....
customer_reviews.author: R. Pendery

customer_reviews.title: planes and nothing i have every found protects them from rust like this stuff it is great
customer_reviews.text: I have several cast iron saw tables, planes and nothing i have every found protects them from rust like this stuff it is great. unprotected they will rust in just a day in humid weather and if someone touches one there will be a rust finger print in hours. with T-9 on the surface I don't have to worry about it even when someone puts a hand on a table and it is not used for a week or so. NO rust! I love cast iron for a solid platform but it does have its drawbacks rust being the big one. This makes that problem go away.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Tick

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spray on bare metal around the shop and wipe dry. It’s like magic, dries, and leaves a protective surface that last and lasts. I would not describe it as “waxy” like the manufacturer. It is just as if there is nothing there, maybe like a semi-gloss clear coat completely dry. Pricey but 100% worth it. No more rusty tools, metal table tops, impact sockets, etc, etc, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Cancerman

customer_reviews.title: Fails after 25% is used!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but it stops working after about 25% of product is used.....wrote Amazon to complain, we’ll see how they treat their customers....
customer_reviews.author: John C. Mclaurin

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable transformation See Picture
customer_reviews.text: The biggest contributor to rust is moisture. Humidity and salt are even worse. My Wife and Son flew up to Indiana to visit her dad and drove back with a truck and a 120 year old shotgun. Wouldn't open, breach bar was broken and a slew of other problems. Then I found out that it was lodged in a tree and it grew around it. After removing a lot of rust. I sprayed it down with the Boeshield. The following morning, my Son goes out to the garage and comes back thanking me for working on it. The bluing is all gone from age, but the barrel is all gray bare metal.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, sprays on wet, leaves dry lube.
customer_reviews.text: I was using this out of a pretty tiny bottle for some stuff. It actually lubricates stuff really well, some doors in my house refuse to stay where I put them anymore, the slightest breeze moves them. But they aren't squeaking any more, either, and that's what I got it for. My bike frame had never been treated, and when I commuted in the rain, rust would come out of it, splatter all over the wheels and the outside and make it look like hell. So I took it apart and sprayed this stuff generously in it, let it drain/dry overnight, and no more rust splatters! Thinking of trying it on the chain now...
customer_reviews.author: M. Frobisher

customer_reviews.title: Great chain lube product.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great as a lube on bicycle chains with it’s wax based formula it lubes and stays put without oily film that is sure to collect dust as you ride. Because of the wax formula the uptube in the can may become slightly plunged and little or no spray will come out of the nozzle. To fix this I put the can in a quart jar of warm water and set it in the sun. About an hour later it sprayed fine. Great product and fantastic customer service from the distributor PMS PRODUCTS.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Imagineer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works good but if it sits for more than a month ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works good but if it sits for more than a month it gums up and it don't work I have 2 full cans than I can't use don't waist ur money on it
customer_reviews.author: Mike  qulafi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff.  Much better than WD for rust protection.
customer_reviews.text: Never tried it as a rusted bolt remover helper like WD-40 but, this is great for protecting any ground or polished surface you might have. Spray it on, wipe off the excess and you have an incredibly slick protective coating. The longer you leave it on the thicker the coat will be. I use it on my planes, table saw and most any tool where rust is a problem. It does not leave that sticky film when it dries like WD does. It dries to a smooth, clean, low friction coating with no unwanted residue. Can't say enough.
customer_reviews.author: Wiz

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my table saw, bandsaw, and table on my sander. All cast iron tops were cleaned and dry when I spray this product on the cast iron tops. I followed the directions exactly as directed. I live in Florida when I did the spraying and we had no rain for several days. The cast iron during that time stayed immaculate. When we got into the rainy season the cast iron started rusting. I was very disappointed. My shop is insulated and air conditioned. The door is always closed and there is no opening to let rain in. I will never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Stops the rust and protects your iron surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing my Saul stop table saw I was advised to purchase the T9 spray to help protect and prevent rust from creeping into my iron worksurface. I routinely spray down all of my iron surfaces and have great results. Thus far when using the T9 protectant I haven’t had any issues with rust or build up at all. I would highly recommend this to any woodworker that has tools such as jointer, tables saws or other ferrous metal tops that are exposed to moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Morosanu

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I use Boeshield on almost all of my tools to keep them from rusting. I like that it actually dries and doesn't leave an oily film. I do a lot of woodworking so I can't have any oils getting into the wood. Works great on cast iron tops like a table saw. Also use it on my drill press and even the bench vise to keep the rust away. I'd recommend giving it 24 hours to dry before using whatever you are putting it on. I recommend spraying it then wiping with a paper cloth to leave a very fine film.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: No nozzle straw
customer_reviews.text: I have an eighteen dollar can of oil with no way to apply it. No application straw. I believe that the product is excellent, but that does me little good when it is only able to be excellent as it lubricates the inside of the can. I would order another, even though I don't need two, if I knew that it would arrive with a straw.
customer_reviews.author: TonyD

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used on a new table saw and miter saw on basement shop which is very damp. Absolutely no rust on cast iron table saw top. Also sprayed down inside receiver of truck. No rust after winter use. Usually the thing rusted shut and hitch is a pain to remove.
customer_reviews.author: rick rose

customer_reviews.title: Better than WD-40
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for an expensive front runner roof rack set up (7K). The bolts (stainless) where getting some rust spots. WD-40 can make a mess on show trucks, so read the reviews, and picked this up. It does last as long as they report, but it does stay on longer than other's. We purchased as a preventive measure, so hoping that it will do the job. We apply about once a quarter (every 60 days) to the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Whispering Barrels

customer_reviews.title: Boeshield keeps tools and metal objects looking like new.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Boeshield on any tools, metal and cabling that will that I buy. For example, I sprayed Boeshield on a new hammer that I had purchased. My grandson left the hammer in his sand box for 3 or 4 days. Without the Boeshield treatment, the hammer would have already shown rust starting but, in fact, it still looks like new. I spray Boeshield on large amateur radio antennas and associated cabling and everything looks new after one year of outside use. I will continue to use Boeshield on all new items which may be used outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cycling Chains
customer_reviews.text: Rather than take the time to really clean my bicycle chain, I use Boeshield as a cleaning lubricant, using a cloth to wipe off the excess grime on my chain. Do it every time before I ride.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great rust remover and preventative
customer_reviews.text: While building our new house, all my woodworking tools were in long term storage. Unfortunately that storage was very damp, and everything got terribly rusty. I used this product and some abrasive sponges to bring everything back to a smooth surface again. So far it seems to be working well, and has kept all further rust away.
customer_reviews.author: med1pilot

customer_reviews.title: Product oversprayed. Couldn't use the straw applicator....
customer_reviews.text: Seemed expensive for amount of area it covered. This product was recommended by a formidable RV guru as a better use for RV slide lube. Product oversprayed and the straw supplied would not insert as it was meant. Product oversprayed and ran down the RV finish, so hand cleaning was necessary. Will not use this product again.
customer_reviews.author: jmoncr

customer_reviews.title: Better than WD 40
customer_reviews.text: This is something I've been using for about 35 years now the price has gone up but the quality has stayed the same. From rusted bolts to door locks it can unfreeze most anything. It's great for preventive problems from salt water or any other problem of dew, just most anything. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its great stuff, but they HAVE TO HAVE A REFUND/REPLACE ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't take it any more. TWO bottle jammed up on me and both were new out of box. Now I'm stuck for winter/summer maintenance switch. Its great stuff, but they HAVE TO HAVE A REFUND/REPLACE POLICY. I need to look elsewhere until they do. OR, I'll just toss $20 bills out the window.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: Pressure in can gone before second use!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Great product but unfortunately I went to use it for the second time and the pressure in the can was gone and it would not spray. Return window had closed. To expensive of a product for that to happen. Update 11/26/2018: I quick reply from Boeshield and they are sending me a replacement can free of charge. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: K D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for keeping tools rust free
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my table saw and other shop tools with cast iron surfaces. It's great for keeping rusty hand prints off the surface from leaning on the cast iron or palms touching it while working. I reapply it every few weeks as it does seam to wear off after a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Nate.....

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Though a bit expensive it does work. After restoring some older hand tools (hand planes) since I was not ready to finish the restoring so after I took the items out of the deruster i put a coating of T-9 on them and they are still rust free. I will be buying again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Hodges

customer_reviews.title: snowblower and lawnmower deck treatment
customer_reviews.text: as per suggestion of a professional, purchased this to use inside of the snowblower box and chute and undercarriage of the mower deck - outstanding stuff. its like a dry slippery oil, basically snow/slush and wet grass does not stick to the metal and discharges as it should. not sure of other uses, but that is what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: KAIFS

customer_reviews.title: Best corrosion prevention ever
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best corrosion prevention product ever. As an example I have a steel Olympic weight set on my patio. I started treating everything with T-9 some 25 years ago. Re-spray every 4 months or so. To this day, NO RUST. Amazing. I have used this product on a ocean fishing boat.; Zero corrosion on electrical wiring and panels. Much better than LPS3.
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Unusable as a spray
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. Unfortunately, the last three orders of this product clogged up and wouldn’t spray. Changing the spray head did not help. I had to drill and pour it out. Very annoying. I kept thinking the next order would have solved the problem, but.........
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Bragdon

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Protects from corrosion on electrical systems, metal parts of boat, autos, bikes near and on the sea water. WD$0 is a solvent and will evaporate. This stuff stays on and protects. I use on all the work I do on salt water
customer_reviews.author: Autoteacher

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the large can
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this in the smaller can before and it worked great. I purchased the larger one and what junk! Got a couple squirts them just leaked all over the place. It lost pressure and made a mess and I got angry and threw it in the garbage. Now the vendor wants me to remove it from the garbage to send back. That would entail me to clean it off and package it. That's not going to happen. I understand that products need to be sent back but how can they expect an oily can to be sent back? What a waste of $20
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good rust prevantative and lubricant.
customer_reviews.text: This is the gold standard for keeping tools from rusting. I use it on everything from my stationary shop tools to hand tools. It protects them from rust better than any product that I have ever used. It is also a fantastic lubricant. I have used it on trailer hitches, hinges, screw jacks and law tractor accessories with good results. Unlike a lot of lubricants, T-9 tends to stay where you spray it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bucy

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using T-9 for well over a decade. Finally ran out and had to buy another can. A little goes a long way. Slick, smooth surface.
customer_reviews.author: Pawkee

customer_reviews.title: simply it works and lasts
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was created by Boeing aircraft to protect there aircraft and highly used in marine craft now so the stuff really works I use 1 can every 4 years on 4 outdoor key locks and one deadbolt and reapplied one a year and there just fine after several years plus compared to WD40 is clear so no apparent application and last up to a year compared to 1 month with wd40 so well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: D. Hardingham

customer_reviews.title: Boeshield is a tools best friend
customer_reviews.text: Boeshield is a tools best friend. Rust preventative and makes the saw, jointer surfaces really slick. Spray on a snow shovel and wet snow will not stick. Environmentally safe as it contains no fluorocarbons. Great penetrating ability Bicycle chains love it as well as garage door opener chains. It will remove minor corrosion, but is not meant for rust removal, just a preventative.
customer_reviews.author: kip

customer_reviews.title: Use it on all my bike chains
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this on all my bicycle chains for at least 10 years and absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product now for 10 years on boat engines and marine parts. Leaves a thin film of wax and truly prevents rust . Dose not interfere with electrical connections. Worth the price to preserve metal and avoid rust .. highly recommend .
customer_reviews.author: John Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great product unless it won't spray
customer_reviews.text: Updated from 2 to 4 stars: I was able to unclog it by soaking in hot water! I've bought two 12-ounce cans and both gummed up - leaving about 90% of the product unusable. For the parts I treated I was very impressed with performance, and I like that it's not as strong smelling as WD-40 Specialist Long-Term Corrosion Inhibitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Bike Chain Lube if used properly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike chain lube for dry, dusty areas if you use it properly. For first time use, thoroughly degrease your drive train (chain, cogs, chainrings and derailleurs) and dry. Apply Boeshield T-9 and let sit overnight. Wipe excess off the outside of your chain, cogs, wheel jockeys and chainring before riding and your drivetrain will be surprisingly clean when you are done riding for the day. To completely remove Boeshield T-9, first degrease your drivetrain as usual and then pour boiling water over it to remove the residules. Don't forget to re-lube not only your drivetrain after using hot water, but your rear hub and bottom bracket as well.
customer_reviews.author: One Day at a Time

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for rustproofing/coating without leaving a greasy finish
customer_reviews.text: Boesheild T-9 is my go to rust preventer for tools, work surfaces and most everything else. It leaves a dry paraffin wax finish unlike some other products often used as rust preventers like WD-40 or greases. This makes it ideal for tools that need a positive hand feel and not a slippery grease finish. I love using paste wax for rustproofing as well, but this product lets you do it very quickly and with almost guaranteed 100% coverage because of the aerosol delivery. Spray on one heavy wet coat and wipe the excess with a rag. Let the product dry for a few minutes and now you have a protected, good looking and great feeling surface.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...bad nozzle
customer_reviews.text: I have bought at least 6 cans of Boeshield T-9 and i love the product. The only complaint I have is the can is far from empty before it stops working. It is a very expensive product to not be able to empty all the contents. I have never contacted the company because I like the product. I may give them a call. I recommend the product. This is the only reason for not giving 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for anything you plan to keep a while.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for YEARS, primarily to protect boat engine surfaces from salt spray. Also have used on the trailer hitch assembly of the truck since it's down the ramp at water's edge too. The data sheet recommends re-applying every few years, but that's partly a function of how much exposure there is against the protected surface. Boeing no longer makes T-9, but the company now doing so under license from the aircraft manufacturer seems to have been loyal to the formulation and the quality of the original.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Great rust protection in my unheated woodworking shop
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Be sure to use enough to apply a good coating. You can leave it on the machine or let dry a few days and wipe off the excess. I spray it on all my cast iron tool table tops and then just leave it alone. When I want to use my table saw I then wipe off the excess before sawing. Then clean the sawdust off at end of day, and reapply a light coat of T-9.
customer_reviews.author: boxer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuffmainly on my table saw and hand tools to prevent rust and I must say it does a remarkable job. I havent seen any sign of rust on anything ive used it on. I live in a very humid area where rust can literally happen overnight. I was a little hesitant to buy because of the price but I definitely think it was worth it now that i see the results. You get a good amount in this can. Ive used it a lot and i can barely feel any difference in the weight of the can. Tip: after every use rinse out or blow out the hole in the sprayer. That keeps it from clogging up.
customer_reviews.author: TJStarx

customer_reviews.title: aerosol can seized spraying anything after initial use...
customer_reviews.text: sadly the aerosol can stopped spraying after the first use, was able to get maybe 10% of the product out before the can seized and stopped spraying at all... very disappointed in this, other wise the little bit that came out of can seems to work good... too bad I can't get the rest of the product to spray out. Amazon wont let you return it either, even though it's clearly defective...
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned very light rust off of a metal table beautifully. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned very light rust off of a metal table beautifully. Easy to use, doesn't smell bad. Can't rate for rust prevention yet, but the ease with which this cleaned the table was remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: Indianame

customer_reviews.title: Tip clogged after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lubricant for shop tools. Only problem is that after just a few uses the spray tip is clogged up. Now I have full can of spray lube that I can't use... Maybe this is a rare defect. Otherwise I would recommend it. I don't plan to return it for the hassle, but I am considering trying it one more time. I'll update my post with the results of the next can.
customer_reviews.author: M. weed

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply, good penetration. I have been applying this to a variety of moving parts and brackets on my RV. Time will tell how it holds up,but from what I've read, I'm expecting good results. 🤞
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: great protection in dry and wet conditions
customer_reviews.text: I use primarily as bicycle chain lube, long lasting, great protection in dry and wet conditions. This is now my go-to lubricant for most household uses. Works best when I use sparingly and wipe off excess after letting it sit for a few minutes to dry.
customer_reviews.author: DrewG

customer_reviews.title: My New Go-To Spray Lube and Rust Protectant
customer_reviews.text: Since this was recommended by an experienced bicycle mechanic as a chain and cable lube I've started using it for all variety of lubrication and rust prevention applications. I just finished end-of-season maintenance cleaning and treating/sharpening yard and garden tools and used T-9 to lube and to protect from moisture and rust over the winter--from hand tools to power equipment. Also like it better than Clean Ride for my bicycle. No waxy buildup with repeated use. Not cheap but very effective.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Defective spray can
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to use anymore than 1/4 of the contents in the container , before it would stop dispensing. This has happened twice now with two different cans of this product. The first can was replaced, and I just recently had rime to use the replacement can, and now this can is doing the same thing. Unfortunately, because of the time from the first purchase, I am not getting the ability to get a new replacement can. I am a very Disappointed amazon shopper.
customer_reviews.author: Mam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing protection on painted steel
customer_reviews.text: I live by the salty spray of the ocean. My steel metal furniture has literally dissolved away within two years. I'd like my outdoor grill to last for a long time, even a grill cover isn't very protective. This product is amazing. It adheres quietly and nearly invisibly. I don't see any weathering after 6 months. I'll reapply annually.
customer_reviews.author: STEM Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service from Boeshield
customer_reviews.text: I got a can that sprayed once in the summer and then not in the fall. Contacted the company and they sent a replacement as long as I gave them the number on the bottom of the can. Great Customer service. This stuff works well to keep rust off my table saw, drill press and band saw. This can will last a long time you use very little. I'm actually thinking of using it under my car to keep some of the winter salt off the nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: dmann

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is not worth the price we paid. We used it one time, the can is still full, but will not spray or come out. What a waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great for firearm protection, especially edc. Also a great chain lube.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Won't spray
customer_reviews.text: At Christmas time my wife bought me two new cans of this wonderful product but I have no way of getting the lubricant out of the cans. Neither can will spray! Brand new! Dead on arrival or something? Expensive and very, very disappointing. I've used this lubricant in the past around my boats and marine stuff. It is great, but you've got to be able to get it out of the can. Aerosol cans are worthless! What a waste of money, product and since the purchase is over 30 days old I cannot return the cans. Not very happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: DAMorrow

customer_reviews.title: Darn effective, expensive
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great re. retention where sprayed and has a fairly long period of effectiveness (e.g., silicone or teflon sprays have very short-lived periods of usefulness, and WD 40 just seems to get gummier with time...so not great in locks and such). And, if you've some rust showing on a metal surface, this will retard the process just about as good as anything short of a wire brush and coat of paint. The downside is it's hard to find, and more expensive than a decade ago - getting to "tipping point" of cost/benefit equation.
customer_reviews.author: osguthjd

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I use this on all of my bare steel equipment, prior to any lubrication. My drill press, table saw and the rest of my woodworking machinery is in my basement, which can never be kept dry enough. I use Rust Free if I find any rust, then clean with mineral spirits and apply a coat of T-9 Protectant. After the first cleaning and application a wipe down with mineral spirits and reapplication of T-9 has kept my equipment rust and corrosion free for the last 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Roy M

customer_reviews.title: Like having a BRAND NEW saw
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my DeWalt table saw; lift gears, all contact points, top surface, fence, fence rails. Like having a BRAND NEW saw. Leaves a fantastic smooth waxed finish - and much easier to use than paste wax. Ran around the house, did squeaky door hinge pins, trailer hitch that was starting to rust, etc. Glad I found this product.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great lube
customer_reviews.text: I use T-9 for pretty much everything on my bike except the chain and it does do a pretty good job lubricating and protecting from rust. Especially on my fork stantions
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Used once, stopped spraying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item but did not use it until a week ago. It is a year old at this point. I did not use it right away. First use, it sprayed fine. I used it on one wood working machine. Went to the 2nd machine and pressed but nothing comes out. Full can and nothing comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Ely

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Darned Expensive But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I've been aware of this stuff for many years. It always seemed ridiculously expensive. This is my first can of it. It is great and promises to go a long, long way.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Koons

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: All purpose lube. We used (a lot of) this to free a completely frozen seat post. And we use it on chains. And absolutely anywhere metal touches metal. And we use it around the house, as an all-purpose WD-40 substitute. And the toddler agrees it's delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Should work well.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars based on the word of a master machinist, I haven't applied it to my tools yet. I got it for a rust preventative protection layer for tools in a building that isn't climate controlled. This guy who highly recommended it lives in an area that is more humid than where I live all year long.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kemper

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for woodworkers with serious machines
customer_reviews.text: Have several large pieces of equipment in the shop that is not climate controlled. Surfaces can rust quickly over the winter. This product cleans well with a scotch pad and lubrication last a long time before rust shows up again
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control!
customer_reviews.text: The propellant leaked out of the can within a month. I love Boeshield, but I paid a lot of $$ for just a few squirts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: avoids rust
customer_reviews.text: This lubricator is superior to others in protecting the bicycle chain from rust, as well as doing all the other things that it should do.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Clio

customer_reviews.title: Leaf spring squeak
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been chasing squeaks in my Dakar leaf springs for over a year. I heard about this product and gave it a try. Success! The squeaks are gone. Not sure how long it will last but it definitely works as advertised so far. I raised the truck up by the frame so there was plenty of slack in the springs. I then gave them a good soaking and let it set overnight so it would penetrate well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of lube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was way overhyped. I am sold. It does everything it says. Have a camper with slide outs. I use this on slide outs and stabilizers. Works great I spray this on in March. Then again towards the end of the season. All the threads are still slick in October when the rv ing slows way down.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie O

customer_reviews.title: I will be buying more
customer_reviews.text: I was having to use a mallet , to move these latches . Sprayed this stuff on them worked a couple of times and now me bed effortlessly. Buy this stuff it works
customer_reviews.author: Terry walls

customer_reviews.title: The best I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I may never anything else ever again. There isn’t enough room to list the things I’ve used this for. Don’t read reviews just get it and thank THEM for the awesome results.
customer_reviews.author: It's a great day

customer_reviews.title: It is probably the best rust preventive available
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Boeshield T-9 for years. It is probably the best rust preventive available. In an independant test it out performed everything else in rust prevention. I primarily use it on firearms but Boeing uses it on their aircraft, so it has a wide range of applications. If you are looking for a rust preventative then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: grblfrtz

customer_reviews.title: Works well to protect the investment in a new tablesaw
customer_reviews.text: Have used this in the past in other woodworking applications(mainly to protect router bits from rusting), but bought this time to protect the cast iron tops on my new tablesaw.
customer_reviews.author: DickMcK

customer_reviews.title: Terrific bike chain lubricant
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time (like riding for 60 years) cyclist and I've tried every chain lube on the market. This is by far the best. It's a wax-based industrial lubricant that dries on the chain in about an hour. It's durable and doesn't pick up nearly as much grit as oil-based lubes do. You spray it on, let it dry, then wipe off the excess and ride. It will last a couple of hundred miles between applications. And it's absurdly cheap. Just be sure to mask your rear wheel with newspaper to keep the Boeshield off the rim when you spray it on the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Phil L

customer_reviews.title: satisfying dust-resisting lubricant
customer_reviews.text: an amazing, quality specialized lubricant. I use it a LOT, especially when/where I don't want grease to collect dust, shavings etc. Dries to a milky film, that really lubricates and protects. I'm a repeat buyer. You bet I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Discoveror

customer_reviews.title: GO-TO for almost everything steel.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this stuff! Leaves a microscopic layer of protection on tools and other metal items you don’t want oily residue all over. There’s better products for tablesaw cast iron tops, but aside from that specific use this is the stuff I reach for anytime I want rust protection.
customer_reviews.author: dliguori25

customer_reviews.title: The only spray lubricant you will ever need.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. We had a few squeaky doors in our home and RV that other lubricating products just didn't solve. This product solved those nagging problems and is the best lubricating product I have ever come across. I also use for preventing rust and corrosion on exposed metal on our RV. A must for our RV for such items as slide-outs and trailer hitches.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: Built a some railing for my son to use skateboarding. I needed something to inhibit rust. It seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Wilson

customer_reviews.title: BEST THAT THERE IS
customer_reviews.text: THERE IS NOTHING THAT COMPARES TO THIS LUBRICANT THIS IS THE ONE, ALSO GREAT FOR BIKE CHAINS AND OVERHEAD GARAGE DOORS
customer_reviews.author: 1hammer1

customer_reviews.title: Terrific lubricant
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stuff ever to lubricate in dry and wet situations. I now ever use this on my hybrid bike which is stored outside and it holds up well. This is my go to lubricant to the point I've thrown away all others.
customer_reviews.author: NJP

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of both WD-40 and T-9. T-9 is a better lubricant and leaves a protective film that does not attract dust. Excellent for bicycle chains. By contrast, WD-40 is a little better cleaner/solvent, but with poorer lubrication and long term protection. There is a lot of similarity in their applications though, so either can be used in either situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for lubricating chassis parts on my wife's Camry and it has worked beautifully. She has an unlimited pass at the car wash and the car gets washed a lot. But this lube stays put...exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: L'Homme de Plume

customer_reviews.title: Good Find.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a lot of things. The battery for my tools was hard to get out of the charger. I used this on all the touching areas of both the charger and the battery. Now, it's easy to pull out. Also use it on all the house window opening and closing mechanisms once a year. That seems to be all that's needed. We have salty air at times in Hawaii and this does a good job of protecting all the moving parts from corrosion. It does the same nice, quick job as WD40 but hangs around longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Hope to keep the salt and rust off.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my new Jeep Gladiator undercarriage. Hope to protect against MICHIGAN salt.Easy to apply and seems to repell water.Used in door seams and underside of Jeep and moving parts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Sioma

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Had some Boeshield T9 in an applicator bottle and liked it so well decided to get a spray can. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: blevtr

customer_reviews.title: Works great even in salt air.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works! Living in the Caribbean we learn to accept corrosion as inevitable. My cast iron tablesaw required near constant maintenance. I always used wax before but that's not enough here. Tried many products but nothing worked. I cleaned my saw, applied Boeshield, let it dry and wiped off the excess. Then a coat of wax. The difference is amazing. I coated my new drill press with it and after a couple months still no signs of corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: can is junk
customer_reviews.text: I cant tell you if the stuff is any good. The first time I used it, The propellant was gone. It was 8 months in a heated shop... A lot of wasted Bucks. Back to WD40
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stockstill

customer_reviews.title: long lasting
customer_reviews.text: besides a lubricant, it has a type of "wax" that holds the lupricant in place. Not an everything lube, but for long term lubrication that you don't mind build up, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Good all purpose protectant
customer_reviews.text: Kind of my all purpose anti corrosion spray. If it might rust or corroded when exposed i’ll spray it with T 9. If I need a penetrating oil or an anti seize compound, or electrical connections involved I tend to make other choices.
customer_reviews.author: funkie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - this stuff works great. Used it to clean up a radial arm saw that someone had thrown in the trash. The thing looks brand new! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: simple512

customer_reviews.title: T-9 - the best.
customer_reviews.text: Simply...great stuff. I have used this for years on everything from lubricating bicycle chains to cleaning and protecting electronic switches that were exposed to salt water. The 12 oz can will last years. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: BEST LUBE AND PROTECTANT
customer_reviews.text: This is simply GOOD STUFF. For most applications it is as good a lubricant or better than Silicone sprays and does a far better job as an anti-rust protectant. Seems to be safe on nearly everything.
customer_reviews.author: Tom48

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I have started using this product. It was recommended by the OEM of my motor home and it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nightingale "Linda"

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price for Well Cared For Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Way better than WaltDisney 40. Only issue: it will clog and appear inoperative in cold temperatures. A soak in hat water cures that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kokomo

customer_reviews.title: Aircraft Grade Lubricant...for your SUV
customer_reviews.text: A YouTube video suggested this for use on sticking automatic running boards, such as on my 2013 Lincoln Navigator. It worked immediately. It is preferred over WD40 as this is a dry lubricant whereas solvents such as WD40 will hold moisture and therefore will only temporarily keep the parts (in this case the retractable running boards) operating smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Hertzair

customer_reviews.title: Will not spray
customer_reviews.text: I realize it has been a while since this purchase BUT husband took can out to use today and it will not spray. This is an unused can that he had in reserve in our motorhome. This stuff is not cheap and to have a useless can is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sj Cruises

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best I have used at protecting against rust. A popular magazine ran a test using a number of rust preventatives several years ago. Boeshield was ranked most effective at preventing rust.
customer_reviews.author: BFR

customer_reviews.title: Great Lubricant
customer_reviews.text: Great non-oil based lubricant developed for Boeing. Good price/ fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: kenc

customer_reviews.title: it is great stuff, you spray it on and it forms ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have never tried this product, and you have a boat, do yourself a favor and get it, I have used this for years, as an aircraft owner, it is great stuff, you spray it on and it forms a waxy protective lubricant that lasts, excellent for salt water applications and such, spray lithium grease is not even in the same catagory
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Keeps clogging up!
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a great product, but the spray nozzle keeps clogging up making it unusable. I've tried to clean it out using several different methods without success. Complete waste of money since I can't use the product.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.P.I.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my tile saw it's always wet and rust easy. It not only cleaned but left a protective coating behind. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Freeman

product_meta.title: BOESHIELD T-9 Rust & Corrosion Protection/Inhibitor and Waterproof Lubrication, 12 oz.
product_meta.description:
Size:TrueBoeshield T-9 was developed and licensed by global aerospace leader, The Boeing Company, to fill a need for high-performance, long-term metal protection and lubrication. T-9's rust preventative spray uses a unique formulation of solvent carrier and paraffin wax coating engineered to penetrate crevices deeply, displace moisture, dissolve minor corrosion, and leave a clean, waxy coating with lasting durability-without using Teflon, silicone, fluorocarbons, MEK, or acetone. Whether it be automotive, bicycle, industrial, lawn and garden, marine, RV or tools, T-9 continues to be the best option for rust prevention and waterproof lubrication.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
On a seafaring yacht, a dusty ATV, or a shower door, T-9 has you covered. Boeshield T-9 endures muddy bike trails, rain-soaked back roads, and salted highways. It withstands farmer’s fields, offshore oil rigs, and carpenter's workshops. For everyone from firefighters and road crews to cyclists and sailors, Boeshield T-9 is the proven solution. T-9 attacks existing corrosion, loosens rusty parts, and flushes out old lubricants. It is also extremely useful for drying wet parts, electrical motors and circuits, ignitions, and connectors. Apply T-9 and wipe off the excess for immediate use. T-9 dries to a waxy, waterproof finish without leaving a sticky film to attract dirt, dust, or mud. T-9 stays liquid long enough to permeate metal crevices and seep deep inside assembled components to leave a durable protective coating as well as lubricating and protecting-all without dismantling your equipment. Apply T-9 to any metal surface and let it dry. One simple step gives you a thin, penetrating film of durable, waterproof protection and lubrication that endures, months after month or mile after mile. T-9 dries to a clean, waxy, waterproof film that won't wash off in rain, puddles, or mud. You can rinse away sand, dust and grime with water, while leaving the lubricant intact. T-9 will not harm paint, plastic, rubber, fiberglass, or vinyl. It can be used on engines, wiring, and belts. T-9 is nonconductive and will not cause short circuits, so it's also safe to use on electronics. Use solvent or any emulsifying cleaner to easily remove T-9, or simply respray and allow T-9 to dissolve itself before wiping it off.
feature_bullets: Boeshield is great for use in marine, bicycles, automotive, tools, RV's, and aviation
Loosens rusty and corroded parts and is safe on paints, any metal surfaces, plastics, and vinyl
Flushes out dirt and old lubricants, displaces moisture, and penetrates moving parts
Dries to a thin, waxy film that clings to metal for months
Developed by the Boeing company for lubrication and protection of aircraft components
Call or email us with any questions or concerns
